Name: The Purge of Babylon: A Novel of Survival (Volume 1)

ReviewList.Text: A decent basic premise kept me reading, but the disappointments kept piling up, and I won't be completing this series.  If you are bothered by inappropriate word choices, this book will have you cringing on a regular basis... perhaps like the character in the book who should be "balling her eyes out."
Boring. Predictable.the writing style seems like it was written for a young adult....who doesnt make very good grades in reading comprehension.

What can I say that the other reviews have not ? Every word of the other reviews are TRUE! Once you start reading, you can't put it down or at least if "life" wouldn't get in the way and than it is very hard not to neglect family and friends. LOVE running across a "true blue" FULL length novel. Too many 200 or 300 page stories out there claiming to be a full length novel. Thanks so much Sam Sisavath for all your hard work. Can't wait for the next one!

I definitely enjoyed this book, with the exception of a couple things, not counting the terrible editing job done with it. It was hard to put down, keeps you needing to know what s going to happen next for sure! The fact the zombies are intelligent is VERY unique and interesting! However, the repetitive nature of much of it got extremely irritating. Captain Optimism? This must have been a line used over 50 times...and the wisecracking, ugh. F first it was funny then exhausting. I wish Danny and will had more realistic fear in at least some situations, and I was irritated by the love stories, roles of females.

If you want to read a great post apocalyptic nightmare...check out Swan Song by Robert McCammon. As for this book, it is a fun bit of action horror hokum. The author does a great job with action and generating tension. He isn't as successful with creating believable or even likable characters we can root for. The two main guys are funny at times, yet are also pretty generic and somewhat obnoxious. The two guys feel as if they belong more in a Call of Duty video game (I say this as someone who loves video games). The women in this book are very poorly written. They exist only to serve the men as lovers. Lara is a terrible, boring excuse for a character. I found the fate of Kate to be eye-rollingly stupid. It falls completely flat because it doesn't fit her characterization at all. The novel reads like a blockbuster movie from the summer....which I appreciate...I just wished it had better written characters. More interesting characters. Thankfully the second book is the series is a nice improvement. Recommended.

I was hoping to really enjoy this book because I really like the genre but this book simply does not deliver, there were some interesting parts but most of it left me disappointed. The dialogue between the two male characters is completely juvenile, it sounds like a conversation between two teenage boys not two men in their mid twenties who are former military, their conversations actually became annoying and distracted from the story. The battle scenes lagged on endlessly, the whole book could have been edited down a 100 pages and nothing would have been lost. The ending was absolutely ludicrous, letting a woman who obviously had severe emotional problems have access to a gun and the the control room, I won't say anything else about that so I don't spoil it for another. The writer had a kernel of a good story but could not build on it so needless to say I won't be reading the next book in the series.

As the headline says a good read and would translate well into a movie. The only thing that bothered me was after leaving the rubble of the sporting goods store,  why they didnt burn down the big box store where all the creatures were hiding. As they were being followed it occured to me over and over.

This book really let me down.  It started ok and they I just couldn't finish it because I knew the ending and I am so disappointed, I would not recommend it to anybody to ready.  This book is composed ideas from several moviews such as Daybreakers (blood farms); World War Z (how zombies just keep on going); Resident Evil (Blue Eyed Monster) and lets not forget the the TV show the Walking dead (how the zombies/gouls work).  "The Purge" is the correct name for this book.
Great idea but nothing happened for over half the book. Super repetitive. Ending was also bad. Nothing is ever explained. It seems like the author made it up as they wrote it.

I have often imagined that I might try to write a post-apocalyptic vampire/survivalist novel, thereby laying claim to a lifetime of movie royalties and advances on future, surely horrible sequels.  The only thing preventing me from undertaking this immense effort has been the suspicion that it might turn out something like this book.  It's boring, it's  poorly written, it's as if you took the entire genre and boiled it for 3 weeks, until it was reduced to some flavorless sludge soldered onto the bottom of the stock pot.  On the upside, Amazon gave me my money back.

Characters have no depth.  Plot constantly moves towards giant shoot outs that seem like they could have been easily avoided.  I do think the author shows great promise.  I like to be taken on a wild ride, love the breaker series, but this was clumsy.  The plot was constantly forced, characters never thought threw anything.

The issue was it just wasn't very good.  I read a lot of the reviews and folks kept saying how realistic it was in terms of the characters and action.  Within the first five pages I was ready to put it down.  Nobody on a tactical team when stacking up to do a breach would be joking around.  And I mean nobody.  The two main characters are laughable in their one dimensional tough guy veteran personas.

Didn't realize I was starting another zombie apocalypse or wouldn't have picked it.  But the characters were interesting enough to keep me reading to the end.  Ok read as a free download but would not recommend for purchase

Heroes and humor. I really enjoyed these characters and I am invested.  Anyone who loves zombies,vampires or things that go bump in the night will get a kick out of this one. I love the humorous bantor it breaks the monotony so many books fall into. Worth the price at full price. Delicious.

The book was okay. It seemed to me that the author tried too hard to come up with "witty" banter between the characters. So much so that many pages, which could've been used for cooking the meat of a good story, got replaced by the "yada yada yada" of characters that were just too cool under fire. The concept of the monsters was okay (a little bit zombie, a little bit vampire, a little bit space alien maybe) but nothing too fearful. Anyway, I'll probably skip the rest of this series.

I found portions of this self-published zombie/vampire apocalyptic thriller to be a lot of fun.  I won't give a synopsis of the story as other readers have done that. I will just say that although the writing quality was not that of high literature, the story for the most part held my interest and there were definitely some shining moments, especially in the banter between Will and Danny, the two SWAT team members who had served together in Afghanistan and who were the brains and brawn in the attempt to herd their little group of survivors to safety across Texas. Another reviewer mentioned that some of the little romantic moments were distracting and inappropriately timed. I agree: the kiss that elicited a moan from Lara during the shoot-out at the school? Elicited an eye-roll from me. The lovemaking scene between Will and Kate in the abandoned house?  Seemed a bit unwise with ghouls trooping by outside and wild dogs wandering in. The way that scene was written also came across as prurient, and I'm sure that was not the intention. Within minutes of disclosing to one another for the first time that they shared an attraction, Lara was apologizing to Will because she couldn't have sex with him that moment because of what the Sunday brothers had done to her? What kind of woman would even dream of going to bed with a guy that fast?  The women in the book were bimbos. Still, I liked the suspense. Will likely read the sequel.

Oh my goodness! 4.6 stars!!!! What a ride! I did not think I would come across a book that I liked as much as The Remaining series, but this book was such fun. I loved it. The author takes quite a different path from most in the "zombiesque" genre and I will definitely read the next one as there are questions to which I need answers. One thing I really enjoyed was the use of humorous banter between the Rangers which helped add some lighter moments to an otherwise heavy and dark situation. Although it took a few chapters to introduce the characters,once the story takes off it doesn't let up. Non-stop action with quite a twist in plot. I can't wait for the next one.

The story is a new twist on the EOTW genre with ghouls instead of zombies. The tale starts with a bang and rarely slows down. It is well written and the characters are very likeable.  As with all books in this genre you have to accept a few coincidences.  It also gets a bit tiring when the antagonists already have what appear to be insurmountable odds in the their favor and the author continues to pile on to the protagonists.  A few errors in terminology and typing, but that has become the norm these days so if that turns you off you are getting less and less to read.  There are also some parts that seem to added because that is in the formula for EOTW books (have to have some bad humans doing bad things for no known reason).  I have not decided if I will read the next book.  I was actually looking forward to it until the ending of this book.  The ending was not so much bad as predictable and overkill to force action out of the survivors.  And of course to give the evil another win.

I went into this book thinking it was a zombie book - it's not.  I would guess it's more of a new breed of vampire book - the ghouls drink blood, sunlight and silver are the only things that can kill them.  But I liked it so much I read book 2 and the off-shoot Walls of Lemuria and Fields of Lemuria about a different group of survivors (I think both groups meet up in book 4).  One minor complaint, it is a bit repetitious - someone is always getting kidnapped by bad guys and escapes or is saved, there is always a big battle of some sort and the ghouls are always on the verge of getting in or get in and, last second, the group finds a way to survive.  But the action is good, main characters are likable and writing is above average - so it's only a minor complaint.  And I want to find out what happens to the characters, so I'll continue to read the series.  Plus (and this is a big plus for me) it's not one of those tiresome "episodes" series where each so-called book is like under 100 pages - these are BOOKS with hundreds and hundreds of pages and while he leaves you wanting more at the end, he doesn't leave you hanging with some contrived cliffhanger.

The concept for this novel is good and some of the authors ideas were creative, however I found myself incredibly turned off by the lack of character development.  Also, the dialogue throughout the book was cheesy and not believable, most especially between the two characters Will and Danny.

Excellent opening to the series.  I'm currently on book 6 of the series, and it has kept up a quick and action packed pace.  One of the things which I have really enjoyed about this book and the rest in the series so far, is that the characters are neither super-hero's nor blithering idiots - they are typically normal people who have found themselves in the apocolypse, with the exception of the two former army rangers.  If you enjoy post-apocolyptic novels, Sam Sisavath really has developed a nice twist on the genre.  I would highly recommend the series, and Sisavath's writing in general - he has a gift with writing.

Not crazy about the fantasy element (yes I know how crazy that sounds given the genre but we are well beyond normal zombies here. Ok, I give up. You either understand what I mean by normal zombies or you don't). But better written than 90 % of the genre. I guess there is no escaping gun porn and typecasting. This book has its share but in lesser quantities than most.

Not much new in the way of zombie books. I like this type of book so I keep reading them, but I really don't know why. The writing was fine, the editors did a good job, and character development was OK. It passed the time on the beach while I enjoyed a few Jack and Cokes.
It was marginally entertaining. Kind of confusing, if you read quickly. Recommend if you have a lot of spare time.

This book is pretty good -- enough to keep me interested to keep reading and find out what's going to happen to the characters. The one thing that really annoyed me were a few errors that stand out to someone who actually lives in Houston, like I do. First, the idea that rush hour in Houston would be dying down by a little after 5pm on a weekday is so ridiculously laughable. Rush hour pretty much runs until almost 7pm on the busiest highways. The other one was referring to I-45 as "the I-45". No one in Houston refers to it like that. It's I-45 or the Gulf Freeway.

Just like the first book in this trilogy... the story is good but the continuous poor editing is distracting.  If you can ignore the horrible editing job, then you'll enjoy this 2nd book of the trilogy.  Be sure to read these in order; it's key to following some of the character back-stories.
it was slow to start,but improved as the book went on .it was good enough that i ordered the second book

I wasn't sure what to expect when I chose this book for my next Prime offering but I was pleasantly surprised.  I wish the characters had more time to develop and the pace wasn't so aggressive but I'm looking forward to book #2.

A different spin on the current zombie-pocalypse craze, but still along the same lines.  But, anyone who has the discipline to sit down, think out a good story, then set it to a book deserves at least three stars.  This just wasn't my cup of tea is all.

This is a decent read. Not going to knock your socks off and could have used a good editor but still interesting enough and cheap enough to read completely. Still not sure if I'll read the next books in the series maybe when I have nothing else to read.

Great post apocalyptic series with a new twist on zombie-like "gouls".  The characters are engaging and sexy without falling into a formulaic romance novel format.  The action is nail-bitingly tense.  Love Will and Danny.

I really enjoyed this book and I'm not a big zombie fan. There was non-stop action, suspense, and appropriately placed humor. There were a few plot twists that I didn't see coming, which always make the story more interesting for me. Will and Danny's banter was hilarious. This is a great book for EOTW and apocalypse fans. I'm already reading book 2.

While I like to use my imagination while reading, and I have to admit I'm only about a third of the way into this book, and I'm not a vampire/zombie lover. I like more realistic true to life type fiction, something more believable I guess. But if you like the walking dead and vampire stuff this is right up your alley. Just not for me.
A rather unique take on a very tired genre. Good twists, good characters and a truly readable story. Better than I expected.....
This book reindex of the WALKING DEAD and Justin Conin's book THE PASSAGE. In both events you are not privy to how it all began, but in this story you are right there in the middle of it starting..

I enjoyed reading this book, and I am curious enough to read the next book but this book does have a couple problems. The characters are two dimensional and the dialogue is predictable. With that being said, the storyline is interesting and the action is fast paced. As far as thrillers go, I was entertained. At the same time, it's not a book I'd recommend unless someone asked specifically for an action zombie book or something like that.

I admit I really didn't like these zombies, but I couldn't put the story down. It really grabs you and keeps you reading, hoping for more information, more clues. But this first story doesn't give you any idea of where they came from or how they came to be. I really hope there's a few answers in the next installment because I came to care about the survivors and hate to see them continue fighting a battle where they have absolutely no hope.

I was intrigued by the write-up on this story. I finished it in one day!  I think I'm going to be a little nervous when it gets dark. You will not be disappointed! No spoilers, get it now!  Go on. Trust me. ;)

Sam's book kept me fully engaged from the first page to the last.  He's created a vampire infested world world with worthwhile characters and a great storyline.  If I was going to nitpick there are a couple of firearms/explosives related errors but they weren't too distracting.  I enjoyed it and look forward to the next book in the series.  Read it, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Since the book only had 3 reviews I debated buying it.  I'm really glad I did!  Once I started the book I couldn't put it down.  The story was great and the author made you care about each character's survival.  I was literally on the edge of my seat during parts of the book because the action/suspense was so well written.  Can't wait for the next book!

I liked it but he is not as good as many other apocalyptic writers. I finished this book but do not need to read the rest of the series. I felt the actions scenes were too drawn out and the ending of this book is typical of the more lazy, less creative zombie apocalypse writers. Not disappointed but not excited either.

Sisavath is a great story teller. Have read some of the cons posted by others, such as the unrealistic continuing to function with recent wounds, but hey! These guys are greater than life, the way storybook characters should be. I have read the whole series, waiting the next!

I liked the characters and I felt the relationships between them were genuine. There are so many great action scenes in this book, and a lot of victorious moments. There are a few sex scenes, but they are done tastefully, and actually fit well into the plot.
This was just too gory for me.. couldn't get past the first chapter.  And I'm not usually thrown off a suspenseful story that easily, but it was just a bloodbath that went on and on.  Not for me.
I've become bored of dystopian tales as of late. It seems the market is flush with them these days. This was a page turner and as soon as I got done with the first book I ordered the second. Enjoy.
Starts slowly builds interest and ends badly. Long read and when u rch at the end after reading for such a long time, it doesnt do justice to all ur reading efforts.
Great adventure with lots of twists and turns. Especially enjoyable with the Texas locations and brings realism to the forefront with local spots being accentuated.
From start to finish one of the most immersive books I've ever read. I couldn't put it down and finished it in days. Super excited to read the next installment.
While fairly well written, this novel suffers from one unforgivable sin- predictability. Every "twist" can be seen coming from a mile away.

This is my first review of anything here on Amazon.  I do like zombies books over the past couple of years and have read a couple of dozen from as many authors.  This one is good writing with what appears to be a typical kind of story until he takes the zombie story and "adds" another dimension.  Some of the story line is formulaic (not sure if that's a word) but enjoyable.  Character development is great and you really get to know the them as they suffer through the purge of the human race.  I like the chapters focus on one character at a time and the fact that he seems to be willing to do unusual things like (spoiler) dream communication.  I have no right to suggest changes when I can barely spell my own name but I wish that he would not make the main two male characters so invincible.  It's just not realistic......and of course realism is what we all read zombie books for.  Excellent job Mr. Sisavath I will be buying your next few books if you keep up the hard work.
Excellent character development. Great flow of action. Looking forward to new adventures with these guys as they move to new cities.
Fantastic!  Great read with everything you could ask for in a novel.  This book kept me riveted from beginning to end.  A must read!
I enjoyed reading it but was not inspired.  I would call it slightly above average zombie survival fare with reasonable characters.
Not much to say really.  Read the book in.like three days.  If you like end of the world stories, this is a great one.

I am a big fan of post-apocolyptic fiction and have read quite a large number of novels and series of novels.  Sam Sisavath's "Purge" series is among the best.  Many digital novels (and even hard copy versions) in this genre are not so well, often containing glaring editorial faults and poor plot lines, with lack of character development and depth.  Sisavath's works are not among those--he is, for a seemingly young writer, very talented and capable of spinning an entertaining and captivating yarn.  I have read everything he has written (or least all this is available her in Amazon) and have never come away disappointed.  Do yourself a favor and try this first book in the series--you won't be disappointed.  I hope he stays chained to his desk forced to crank-out more work in this continuing Purge saga....
fun, engrossing story!  written in an engaging style, good reading for fun.  Am going to continue the series...

I love ZA stories and this series is one of my favorites.  For comparison I also follow Slow Burn, Arisen, Zombie Fighter and Whiskey Tango Foxtrot among others.  I also follow authors like Matthew Reilly, James Rollins and Jeremy Robinson.  The net net is that I love action and more action.  While the Purge series offers plenty of action, the characters are well defined as individuals.  And the key to a good series for me is how much I am invested in the characters, which in this case is plenty.  Having read all five installments, I truly care about their welfare.  If you are a ZA fan who likes well paced stories with likeable characters, I highly recommend the Purge series and encourage you to start the journey with this book.

Wow What a story!! I cannot begin to tell you how absolutely I was wrapped up in your tale! Great characters and heart pounding excitement! It was all I could do to try and sit back off the edge of my chair and slow down. Danny and Will are fun-tastic and what a great take to create two main characters and blending them into one. I read a lot of books and often find myself reading the same "great" books over and over... I hesitate to throw other names out there but your story belongs in the top tier amongst my other favorite authors; John Norman, Roger Zelazny, George R.R, Martin. This is a fantastic read terrifying, heart warming and fast.... very very fast paced. Color me a fan! Congrats on writing such a great novel.
There are a lot of bad books in this genre, but this is one of the good ones. I enjoyed it a lot.

This book held my attention and I enjoyed reading it.  I will definitely get book two to see what happens next.  My only complaint, and it's a little nit picky, is this:  I am an avid reader and when I read, I really lose myself in the story.  It often was hard to lose myself in the story while reading this book because of sentences here and there that were hard to follow and very poor grammatically - things you rarely see in published works. It was annoying because sometimes I'd be reading a really gripping part of the story and then, bang!  What?  What did that say?  Wait..  what did he do?  Shoot,  I have to re-read this sentence three times to get it.  This is annoying...  Well, you get the idea.

It has been a while since I have gotten sucked into a series so completely that I had to read each & every book in the series as soon as I had finished the previous one.  It happened with Sisavath's "Purge of Babylon" series.  The characters are engaging, the dialog sparkles, and Sisavath can create monsters and the post-apocalyptic world they inhabit.  If this first one grabs you, I guarantee that you will want to read ALL of the books in the series AND the companion Lemuria series set in the same post-apocalyptic world but following new characters.  I understand that the next Babylon novel will bring the two storylines together, and I can not WAIT for that one.  An enthusiastic 5 stars!

I honestly did not know how I would like this book when I first started reading it.  It is gritty, rough and painfully real. But then the imagery and realism starts engulfing you and before you realize it..WHAM! you are sucked into the world of the Purge. I can honestly say I have never read a book so real and yet so intoxicating.  This book truly captures relationships, survival and the ying and yang of human...and ghoul...nature.  This would make one fantastic movie as long as they stuck to the storyline. The series is now in my top 5 most favorite books of all time...it is that good. I highly recommend to those who love action and adventure...and you are not scared of the dark.

Author shows great promise, good story line, great characters, coherent thought processes.  If it weren't for the jarring technical slips, I would have rated it a "5".  The author seemingly knows little about guns in general and almost nothing about shooting.  As the series is a serial shoot-em-up, a little review by a half-knowledgeable shooter friend would have helped.  Revolvers do not have safeties, the world does not revolve around Glocks and you are not going to find any in an armory. a 100 meter shot with a rifle is a "gimme" not a a tough sniper shot, etc.  And hydroelectric plants don't have domed reactor containments, nor are they found in a lake.

It's a post- thriller, along the same lines as The Walking Dead.  There are even parallels to TWD:  our heroes flee the undead masses in search of a "safe place", but will they really be safe there?  You'll have to read it to find out.  There is corny/cool dialogue between the two male protagonists, tons of real world tactics employed to keep the survivors alive, a ripsnorting fast pace, and overall interesting characters doing whatever it takes to make it to another day.  Gotta love Plan Z!  The author isn't afraid to take chances, to kill off characters, and to introduce new concepts into this genre.  I liked it, bought the other two books in this series.

Purge of Babylon is a captivating adventure tale.  The characters are developed significantly better than in many books for this genre.  Multiple characters have their own "inner life" and they are 'fleshed' out (pardon the pun.)  Characters are imbued with their distinguishable vocabularies, attitudes, syntax and mannerisms.  The adventure itself never ceases to surprise.  At least most of the plot not predictable. Some of the plot turns are anticipated by the reader, but it's OK because you still want verymuch to see/learn what is going to happen next.  It was a pleasure to spend time with this book.  I have already purchased the Book 2 of the series.

Hmm. Why do I like this series so much. I have never been into zombie, monster/horror fiction therefore I don't know if other reviewers'  comments about the series being predictable are correct. I got this first book out of curiosity and am now completely hooked. I have read all of the books published in this series. I agree with several of the negative comments about the female characters and that they are not fleshed out. This does change as the series progresses. I do catch myself rolling my eyes at times and thinking "Really?".  That being said I will continue to read this series and recommend it to my friends who like sci-fi.  It is pure escapism.

I actually ended up with this series from a Bookbub recommendation, and l loved every book in this series.  Sam Sisavath is now an author I "watch" for new books. The Purge was a fun read, with an excellent plot, it was definitely NOT predictable, had great characters, etc. None of the bad editing or annoying or incorrect word choice often found in new writers in this genre. I found myself laughing out loud at times from some of the dialogue, and these characters were the kind of people that you start to think would make interesting friends.  I would highly recommend this series for anyone who is a fan of zombie, dystopian, or sci fi type plots.

There are parts of this book that are so intense that it was impossible to stop reading. I could do without the sex scenes. So I just glance over it to see when it's over. I love the back and forth banter of Danny and Will. Makes the fact they have been through a lot together believable. I have much respect for military and police forces so I am rooting big time for them to survive. There are a couple of times where the read slows and I was able to put it down and come back to it later but for the most part I was always wanting to know what was coming next. Just purchased the next book in the series so I am looking forward to starting it soon.

A riveting book and series. I have now finished 5 books in this series. This a genre I have just started to read and I am impressed with this author's ability to write and keep me interested. I am 54 years old and my tastes have varied greatly over the years but the one constant has been if a writer has grammatical errors, factual errors, too many overused lines or just generally poorly written I will not read beyond the the 1st 2 chapters no matter how good the story line. This series of books and thus their author has done an amazing job of holding my interest throughout this series. Kudos t a job well done.

I went into this book expecting zombie apocalypse fiction (which I'm always a fan of) and instead got something more original.  The characters are well-written, and the action is intense and fast paced, with a plot that unfolds like an action movie, all the way to an ending that just begs for a sequel.  The dialogue is often funny, and provides a bit of comic relief during some pulse pounding moments.  I can honestly say that once I realized that this wasn't a zombie story with the usual rules, I never knew what to expect next, which is high praise for any book in the genre.  Can't wait to read the sequel!

I'm definitely interested in seeing where the story goes next. I like the character development and the fact that this isnt your typical zombie apocalypse story. It has its own twist that makes me curious to see what happens next. I was shocked to see what happened with one of the main characters towards the end. And was totally infuriated at that character for what they did but not at the author for writing them that way. I have to admit it made it more interesting and gives the reader an insight they didn't otherwise have. More clues as to what's really going on. Looking forward to book number two!

I don't write reviews of books too often but I enjoyed this so much I felt that I should. Sometimes I found myself tearing through this book so quickly and becoming so engrossed that I had to remember, it's not real. I felt like I was there with the characters and had to know what was happening or how it turned out regardless of how tired or hungry I was. That's how I know it was a great book. I don't really like the whole Zombie thing usually but I saw how great the reviews were and I just wanted to let other people know it is a great read. It's not even my preferred genre and I loved it.

Good solid story about not-quite-zombie-but still-darned-creepy monsters and a band of human survivors. The guys are all good looking and smart and tough. The wimmin are all extraordinarily good looking and smart and tough. Brutality and rape rolls right off their shapely shoulders. Characters are beaten and shot and left for dead but up and around running and shooting baddies the next day. It might sound like I didn't like this book but I really did. And - happy days! - the editing was pretty good. If you're a  post-apocalyptic zombie junkie like me, don't miss this one.
Some grammatical errors, but not enough to take away from an excellent story!

I bought this book on a recommendation from a friend and am sooo glad I did!! About halfway thru this first book I went out to Amazon and bought the rest of the series because not only had I begun to care about these characters really quickly, the writing was really good and allowed me to get lost in the story and not keep being pulled out by mediocre phrasing or spelling errors like has happened in a few books I recently read.  I quickly finished the first book and am on the second book in the series and look forward to seeing where this ride will take me::)

I thought this was going to be just "another zombie book", wow was I wrong. This is something else, something more, something better. He hit this one out of the park and turned the genre on it's ear. This is the 6 million dollar book (books?), better, faster, stronger all the way around. Story line, characters , and "ghouls" The whole series is just edge of your seat good. I have now read all 4 books in one week, more please!!!! Pick this up and be ready to forget all you know about the end of the world because he has just changed the rules..

Fast paced post apocalyptic fiction that doesn't waste time getting right to the complete collapse of civilization.  The bad guys are vampire like creatures which is not a spoiler since they are recognizable in the first few pages.  It's not War and Peace and could be read and understood by your average sixth grader but still manages to have well drawn and interesting characters who behave in reasonable, sensible ways so that you start to care about them.  Or really hate them as the case may be.  Good first book if you like this sort of thing.

As many have said, this story started out great.  I stayed up way to late reading it.  The action was nonstop and the characters interesting.  But then it just became more and more over done - so much so that I began skimming about two-thirds of the way through.  I began to find the unending banter between the main characters more annoying than funny.  I finished this book but I think I'll skip the rest of the series.  I may be missing many more hours of good reads, but as was said SO MANY times throughout this book, what's the point?

I'm a picky reader, and I've read my share of amateur survivalist fiction on Amazon.  I found many of the stories to be entertaining, but forgettable.  Then I discovered this story.  It is well written with great characters whom you actually root for.  The battles are epic, and the plot twists are quite memorable.  This was an amazing story, and I was sad to see it come to an end...then I discovered that it is merely the first in a series.  This is, by far, the best "no name" author that I've discovered on Amazon.

Overall, an enjoyable read if one can put aside reality for a few hours. The principal characters' repartee is amusing as they jibe each other while using their U.S. Army ranger skills to fend off relentless attacks by armies of blood-lapping ghouls. This would be a five star book if the story had an ending -- any ending, happy or not --  instead of what appears to be a teaser for the author's next book continuing the story (which I will read when it is available because I want to see how this nightmare is resolved).

I love post-apocalyptic novels. I'm a glutton for punishment I guess. After all, it's not a matter of if, but when we screw the big pooch. Right? Now, I doubt it will come down to zombies or vampires, but it's fun to imagine. And, while this book was definitely in the "imagination fun" category, it tends to drag and be a little predictable in some places. However, if you want a quick, vampiric, post-apocalyptic read that will pass the time and make you smile over Danny's "jokes," this will do it for you.

Not corny as other apocalypse books are now days.  The story is well thought out and has a flow that makes sense.  Great characters on the two male leads. They defy the boring brutes or the overly pretty boys that have become the norm.  I came to care about the other characters as well.  Interesting, fast paced, serious, funny, action packed with a little bit of the scary factor thrown in...this book covers all the bases.  I hope the next book follows along the same lines. I look forward to finding out.

Great series. I am on the 4th book and they are getting better and better. I have read a lot of zombie books/series over the past few years and this is one of the better ones. It takes a different approach to the zombie's abilities. Some of the other series I liked have been: The Remaining, Arisen (has its ups and downs), The Gathering Dead series (really good), and The Slow Burn series (funny, good). Personally, I like zombie books that have some humor and a military "waste them" approach.
Couldn't keep my interest, got bored, stopped reading it
fantastic book read it in one day could not put it down.  Will be waiting for the sequel.  New twist for a survival book enjoyed it ..
This was a good read. Fast paced, high action, and entertaining. Characters you come to love. This book does a great twist on the undead/vampiric apocalypse genre. High recommended.

It's hard to stand out in this over populated genre but SS stands tall. The action is right there from the start and the characters are all likable. The banter between Will and Danny injects the right amount of humor in an otherwise humorless situation. I'm glad to see that SS has not just written this as a "one and done" story. I wish more writers would keep the drive alive so to speak. Well being from Boston I'll end with this " This book was wicked pissa!!! Thanks Sam!!
Action packed great charector development, a real page turner.

In a single night, the entire world is overrun with undead creatures. As impossible as this scenario may sound, author Sam Sisavath makes it seem believable. Sisavath's writing is very down-to-earth, giving realistic voices and emotions to his characters. The heros have a very clear idea of right and wrong, and the monstrous villains are as smart as they are formidable. This is an action-packed read, with horror and thrills around every corner. Recommended.

As I've stated before, I base my opinions, to a large extent, on how well I relate to the characters in a story. Do I like them, hate them? Mr. Sisavath has succeeded in making me care... and hate. I found, as I read Babylon, that I desperately wanted Will and Danny, and to a lesser extent the rest of the band, to survive. I also wanted the bad guys to die. And not just die but die in the most painful way possible. By that measure, excellent! Excellent!!

This book was amazing, I have read a lot of the zombie genre and I gotta say this was one of the creepiest takes on the undead I have read, I loved the way this book starts out scary and maintains the suspense thru out the book,  The characters were great and the emotion and pain they felt were transferred to its reader, I could not turn the page fast enough, read it during the day because at night this book will scare the bejeebers out of you!

I blew a whole night reading this story! Characters and plot were believable not to mention a bit scary too. Sort of like the W.D. series, only better. Had the right amount of description that you could use to fill in the blank spots. Stories that you scare yourself are much better than ones that led you by the hand insisting that you see this or that. Looking forward to reading more adventures. Two thumbs up and both toes. (lol)

This is a whole new twist to the zombie apocalypse/dystopian genre.  Life is tougher and the dangers are greater. The characters are great and you spend a lot of time cheering for them to make it out of one life threatening event after another. I've gone through the first 5 books of this series like a chocolate addict with a bad of M&M;'s. Definitely start the The Purge and save the Lemuria books until after the 3rd Purge book.

I completely stumbled upon this book, but oh how happy am I that I did! I love post apocalyptic fiction and have a special place in my heart for zombies and vampires. I spotted a review for this series and ended up downloading the whole series on a whim. I'm a fast reader, but I'm off work right now since I just had surgery. All I have to say is any book that I hate to put down is worth the read. Read it. You won't regret it.

I found this book sometime ago when I was searching for a new author, it stayed on my wish list for months. Once I finished all the newer books from my favorite authors I took a chance on this one. It turned out to be a good choice. Sam Sisavath has the beginning of a great series. Sam is a good story teller with just the right amount of detail. Purge read quickly with non stop action. I have already purchased the next book.

The best book I've read since Justin Cronins-The Passage and The Twelve. The writing was very reminiscent of Mr. Cronins also. This story was very character driven and I love that. The action was fast paced with enough time in between to catch your breath, relax a bit, then go, go, go! I've again found a favorite new author. Now I'm off too read the second book-Gates of Byzantium. Yep, I'd recommend this story and author.

Incredible story! Draws the reader in and keeps them in suspense... continuously! Loved it and immediately downloaded "The Gates of Byzantium". Finished both in less than a week and am now anxiously awaiting "The Stones of Angkor". (Hint... hint... HURRY!!!)

I truly like the story.  Let me point out that I'm female, so perhaps I'm not the target audience.  Much of the book is fun to read.  Characters are well done/developed.  However, (you could tell that was coming, right?)  There is far too much unnecessary detail . Example -  the first sections of the book, that deal with revealing the main characters, is so repetitive, I skipped much of it.  Okay, there's a lot of blood.  Every character took pages and pages describing the blood and destruction.  We get it - a simple paragraph sighting  the same reactions and vision would suffice.  Also, I really don't think if I'm in a life threatening situation, my thoughts are going to be so mundane.  Perhaps one characters' mind might be affected that way, but probably not the majority.  I should have read about the author, because throughout the book, I wondered how old he was and how many relationships he's had.  The sophomore banter between men and women (flirting?) was distracting.  The battles were  the same and told over and over.  Summary?  The book could be cut to a 1/3rd a be better.  I skimmed full chapters due to all of the above.  Worth reading if you like repetition and again, the story is very good.

When it come to a book, character development is important to me. I want to connect with the characters, know them, love them, hate them, etc... I originally purchased the Purge of Babylon on my Kindle Fire. Halfway through the 3rd book I broke my Kindle Fire so I purchased all the books in the series on paperback. Purge of Babylon was hard to put down, I read the whole book within a couple of days. I really enjoyed it.

I read this book several months ago and I promised myself and the author Sam Sisavath that I would come back and rate it.  I'd give it a TEN if I could.  I love the characters and the plot twists.  I originally thought this was a three book deal and was finding that I wished it could go on and on.  And it has, since I've just finished the sixth book and am eagerly anticipating the seventh.  I highly recommend it.

I like post-apocalyptic horror but in general do not enjoy zombie/ghoul books. The Purge of Babylon definitely changed my mind! I could not put this book down and read far into the night way too many times. It has a twist on the whole zombie thing that was unexpected and refreshing. It is very fast-paced and action packed. I am definitely looking forward to reading the remaining 2 books in this series.

A really good, and importantly, long and well-written apocalyptic book.  Even better - one of several long ones.  I like to get lost in Post-A worlds, and this one has a spin that I haven't seen in anything yet (a distant premise from the Will Smith movie in NYC - but that's the closest I got).  No typo's, some good humor, and sex, too!  Gotta love it!  5 stars, and looking forward to more!

Passed this book over many times during my search for the next great read...I am glad I took the chance on this book...The banter between the 2 lead characters is what kept me reading long past when I should have been asleep..I did have to power through the first few chapters..But I am very glad I did...It is a good read and for the 99 cents you cant go wrong..Well worth the lack of sleep:)

Awesome, awesome awesome;  Stayed up three nights in a row listening to my Kindle "read" this book.  Great story and thank you for not dragging out any sex scenes; I've actually stopped reading a good story because of that; you WON"T regret buying this book; Haven't read such a good story in a long time; luv the humor between Dan and Will.  On to Book 2 :)

Awesome book! I couldn't put it down! Great tension and twists and turns. I love how the author tells the story from different character perspectives and perceptions. I have already downloaded the next book in the series and am thrilled that while new characters are introduced, my favourites are still struggling with their own survival. Well written and a great read!

I really enjoyed this book! It's full of action and suspense. The characters are easy to relate to and I love the humor and camaraderie between the two main guys. I am about halfway through the second book in the series and I love it just as much. Yes, some of the scenes and how they survive are somewhat hard to believe but who cares! A very entertaining read.
Not a bad take on the end of the world scenario

This is a great start to a really good series in the "zombie Apocalypse" genre but with a new and more sinister take. There are some issues with some of the fact checking that was done involving the shooting scenes. (80 yards is not a very far rifle shot). I have read all three of the series so far and look forward the the 4th and 5th installment

I'm giving this 5 stars because the story was good, characters were great and the writing flowed wonderfully.  But, they're vampires.  No where in the books did they call the "ghouls" vampires.  They suck blood and the sun kills them.  They're vampires.  It kinda made me nuts that they never once figured out these things are like vampires.  :)

I've read the ebooks and enjoyed every single one.  The audio book is a nice way to recap the action even though I'm not a fan of audio books; I tend to fall asleep.  This was a great companion during the daily commute, hearing the narrator act the dialog for Will and Danny was worth it.  The pace is steady and exciting, just as I read it originally.

This is  NEW and frightening twist to the zombie apocalypse genre of books.  I really enjoyed the story and have bought the next two books, just to see where Sisavath takes us.  So far, the second book is at least as good as this one.  Well developed characters that you get attached to and a base story that is enough different to keep your interest.

I really enjoyed this story! It was a refreshing New take on the ever popular apocalyptic theme. It was very well written and I connected with the characters. I was also relieved to find the technical aspects were spot on. I find it very distracting when authors fudge the facts. I can't wait to read the next book in the series.

Honestly, I fully expected this to be just another mediocre (at best) free Kindle ebook.  Wow, was I pleasantly surprised when it wasn't!  Being a huge fan of apocalyptic and post-apocalyptic fiction, it takes a lot for me to really be blown away with this genre.  I truly did not expect that Sam Sisavath would be the one to do that, but he did.  While some of the plot twists are predictable, in my opinion it does not detract from how great the action and story line are.  The two main characters are clever and witty and there is a lot of humor mixed in with the chaos and general maelstrom of this book.  I was not bored for one minute reading it, and that's saying a lot for me as I'm not one to value endless details - I want the story to unfold without getting caught up in the minutiae.  I was very impressed that there were almost no typographical or grammatical errors either, so I'm guessing that either this author is very good with proofreading or he actually had an editor.  Really great take on the "zombies" as well, if you can call them that - suffice it to say that they're not your average zombies.  Overall, I was greatly impressed with the book and am now going to have to buy the next two books so that I can continue on this crazy ride with Will, Danny, Lara, Carly, Vera and Elise.  Read it for yourself, I don't think you'll be sorry!
Sam has done it again can't wait for the next book and a Movie I hope.

I initially regretted buying the book, I was looking for sci-fi. Then starting the book it felt like a paraphrase of the walking dead series with some vampire attributes, but the book kept getting better and better. I loved the humour, the very realistic military banter and the plot twists, and couldn't put the book down. This is a different take on the post apocalyptic genre.

I never thought I would be reading a story about the undead and enjoying it. So much so that I downloaded the next two columns in the series. But then again, it's not so much about ghouls as about the characters who are very likable, and who have to reach into their depths to rise to any challenge that comes along. I was riveted!
Can't say enough how much I enjoyed this novel. Worth every penny.  I Can't wait to start the second book.
Read all three in three days.  Now have to wait for #4. Hurry !!!!

Well worth the five stars! I really enjoyed this book and highly recommend it. Fast-paced and very well written, I could hardly wait to return to the book when I had to put it down. The characters are brilliant, I love Ben and Will and the attention  n to detail is exceptional. The ghouls are good and a great change from zombies. I have already started the second book and have the third ready and waiting but I am trying not too read too fast so I can make them last. The new characters just add to the story and the action  hots up. The ghouls we'dmy the only problem! Read them , you can't be disappointed .
My first "zombie" novel and I have to say that I enjoyed it.  Good survival story.

I loved this book. The characters were incredible and well written.  The storyline was unique- as in, not a typical vampire book.  Ghouls is an apt description.  I enjoyed the excitement of the book and couldn't put it down! I thoroughly enjoyed the sense of humor of the main two characters. Bought the second book immediately after the 1st one. Can't wait to see what happens next.
Excellent characters and action sequences

I am torn on this book.  Sam Sisavath has written a winning formula, and he does it well.  The macho guys take out some zombies, save the girls, make some funny jokes while they are doing it, and then continue down the road on their quest to survive.  But the problem I had with the book, was that it starts to get a little repetitive after awhile.  Really its the same formula over and over again, and all though its a good formula, I started to lose my interest towards the end of the book.  Not a bad book at all, but I didn't enjoy it enough to move onto the second book
thoroughly enjoyed it and will read the next one!

While this book was interesting, it tends to drag in a some spots. Keep reading as there are very intense and entertaining parts. Caution as there is some language and encounters that might offend some readers. Overall a decent read.
Action packed with continual plot turns and twists.  Travel along with the characters to see how they manage to adapt and survive.

I picked up this after reading Guillermo Del Toro's "The Strain" trilogy and while I liked Del Toro's books better, I  found this to be a fast paced adventure that held my interest. I liked it well enough to buy the second book and will start it right away. The one negative critique I have is the central characters, former army rangers, Will and Danny often skirt the edge of being just a bit too "Chuck Norris". They are sometimes just a bit unbelievable, almost superhuman. You get a sense that they cannot be killed. But the author walks a fine line and doesn't go too far over the edge and, after all, it is a post apocalyptic fantasy so some of that is okay.  Overall, I enjoyed the book. It won't make my list of favorite books but it was good.
Turned out to be a pretty good book. Not another typical zombie book. It has an actual storyline and the characters had personality. Off to read Book Two.

Thought I had seen all the story lines possible in the Walking Dead series, but Sisavath has a new take on the story. Very intriguing underlying theme to the Antagonists that I didn't expect. Great characters and character development too. Can't wait to read the next book!
Great to the end!! Looking forward to reading the next one! Couldn't put it down! A unique twist to zombies!
Excellent writing and I love the character developement. The characters are amazing in a very difficult world! I just bought books 2 and 3!
Really enjoyed.  Looking forward to book two. Not my normal genre, but I still found this to be a fast paced and exciting book.
Good stuff easy read with characters you care about.  A nice twist to the zombie genre.  Even a love interest
Good story with relatable characters. The writing is fast paced and keeps the reader interested. I think it's going to be a great series if this first book is any indication. Highly recommend it...

Picked this up from the Lending Library.  Glad it was offered on here because I probably would have never checked it out otherwise (this is not exactly my kind of genre).  If you can make it past the first 30 or so pages of cheesy dialogue, and machismo, you will be rewarded with an immersive, nail-biting, thrill ride.  Definitely has some creepy/chilling moments, but (as another reviewer stated) not enough to disrupt my sleep.  Eagerly awaiting my month to reset so I can pick up book 2 from the LL.

I've read the first three books in this series and decided I had to come back and write a review for the first one to encourage others to pick up this book.  I am not a fan of Zombies, so I'm not sure why I picked up this book.  I'm really glad I did though.  Sam Sisavath can write!  He is one of those authors that I will follow and read whatever he writes.  This is not a horror zombie book, it is an end of the world tale of survival.  The tension is palpable as the weary group of survivors fend off zombies every night, and other survivors during the day.  The world building is intelligent, and the characters are fleshed out.  If you like dystopian fiction, pick up this book now, you won't be disappointed.

This book takes what's great about end of the world zombie stories and combines it with nearly unstoppable ghouls. Great likeable characters and non stop action and suspense. I hope it's made into a movie and I am buying the next book in the series right now. Best book I have read in awhile!!!!
Action packed, an the added humor made the story an easy read.  Can't wait for the next book in the series..

Great story, looking forward to getting stuck into the next book. Have read a lot of zombie and disease apocalypse books but this is a good twist with a vampire and intelligence vibe. Makes you want to see what happens next in terms o what's the ultimate plan for the vampires and Mabry.

Great story and very well told. Rarely do I ever give a 5 star rating but this one came close... I've already purchased the next two installments. Sam Sisavath is definitely on my radar from here out.

Really like the monsters "dead not stupid" it makes for much more interesting character play than lame shuffling zombie books.  There are a few plot holes considering the level of training and tactical acuity the main heroes display.  But hey you have to keep the story going some how.

I've been on a Zombie/Apocalypse kick for a couple of years now and it's pretty much all I read anymore. I've read a lot of good, and quite a few bad books during that time. But Sam Sisavath has written the best end of days book that I've read since Stephen King's The Stand. That's saying a lot coming from me, because in my opinion, Stephen King is the master of the horror genre, and The Stand is my all-time favorite book. But The Purge of Babylon comes in a close second. It's not the same story at all...but it's almost just as good. There were times when I almost found myself sweating wondering if my favorite characters would be able to find a safe place to hole up. It's a very suspenseful book. Sisavath is quite good at projecting how the characters are feeling, from hope, to new love, to crushing despair. This book has it all. And to top it off, there's at least two more books in the series and I just downloaded both of them. Usually I will only download one book at a time from a series just in case the writer takes a turn toward bad writing. But with Sisavath, I can't see that ever happening. I'll be on the lookout for any new books he puts out in the future. He is definitely worth checking out if you like the end of days stories as much as I do.
This book kept your interest the whole time. I gave up sleep time because I felt like I had to finish this book once I started it.
Good action packed read that kept me hooked.  Recommend to sci fi or action fans.  The book starts right out with action.

This is a good vampire/zombie novel.  The author has a good ear for dialog & his characters are not cardboard stereotypes.  I would have liked a little more character development but I never got bored.  The plot moves right along with good pacing & what happens next is not obvious.  I am looking forward to reading the next two books in the series.
A good story, well written with interesting characters. There is also a lot of humor in the story. Highly recommended .
I REALLY ENJOYED THIS BOOK. I LOVE SURVIVAL HORROR, AND THE PURGE OF BABYLON WAS A FUN READ. I LOOK FORWARD TO THE NEXT BOOK IN THE SERIES.

Ok, so there are a lot of "End of the World" horror/thrillers available these days so it's not easy trying to pick one worth reading. I got lucky when I picked out The Purge of Babylon by Sam Sisavath. This book is scary, creepy and fun especially if you are like books involving a military tactical flair. The characters are pretty well developed and the prose are well written and paced to keep you reading. Since it is the first book of a series, I am hoping that following books build on the horror and creepiness even more since by then end of this book I was so familiar with the creatures that their "creepiness" kind of wore off a bit (hence the 4 stars instead of 5). This book is definitely worth the read as I enjoyed it very much.
This is one of the best books I have read in a long time. Keeps your interest all the way through!
Great book. A different twist to the virus, end of world books. Well written with great characters that you find yourself cheering on throughout the book.

I have to give The Purge of Babylon five stars. I enjoyed reading it, and the characters Sam Sisavath created were great. The ghouls somewhat reminded me of the creatures in the Will Smith movie, I Am Legend. I think most people that read this genre of book, will enjoy reading this as much as I did.
This book is a great post-apocalyptic story of survival. You find your eyes glued to the pages so you don't miss a single thing.

I really never thought I'd be a fan of Zombie novels, but I found this fast paced and fun.  I really got into it on a road trip and found myself racing to finish before we arrived at our destination.  Definitely recommended.

Wow!  This is a phenomenal series!  At first I thought this would be the run of the mill zombie book but not at all!  These books will leave you on the edge of your seat and unable to put it down!  Please hurry with book four!!!!
Witty banter between the two main characters makes this a good read.  I will probably pick up the next one.

Really liking this book. After reading lots of the now popular zombie books, this was refreshingly similar without being the same old zombie book. Something inbetween zombies and vampires. I loved it. Reading second book now

What a great story with a great concept. This is not your post-apocalyptic zombie story, it involves something else (no spoiler here) that in some respects is way more dangerous. The novel is about survival. It's main characters are engaging and impossible not to like; therefore, easy to follow and identify with. I really enjoy the style of writing whereby each chapter focuses in on one of the main characters, but involves others, as well. It surprisingly ties together quite well. Kudos to the author for coming up with an extremely interesting take on another type of apocalypse with a great storyline and really interesting characters. Can't wait to jump into book #2 - 'The Gates of Byzantium.' A fun read that was nearly impossible to put down once started. Thanks for the suggestion, Amazon!

I liked everything about this book except for there being no explanation for how this transformation started. I know there is a second book, which must have the explanation in it. But the first book has no hint for what started all this. I think the reader should have some idea as to how this all started without having to read the second book.
Once I started reading this it was impossible to put down. Never a dull moment. Love the characters. Can't wait to start book 2 of the series.

The action scenes were very intense, with good details. The author appeared to know what he was writing about weapon wise or did very good research. Some parts seemed a little unlikely, especially how long two guys could hold off thousands of ghouls and never get seriously injured or die. Character development was good,  I liked that the story is told from multiple points of view. I enjoyed the book as a stand alone novel, even though it is part of a series.

Well written action sequences, the banter between Will and Danny reminds me so much of ribbing and joking I experienced with the my teammates when we were in the field.  It would be nice to have our protagonists develop a bit more depth of character, but thats just an observation and not a complaint. The world Sam Sisavath has created is frightening; however, more frightening and dangerous than the "ghouls" is the element of the collaborators. Imagine an army of Renfields, desperate, stupid, vapid humans willing to do anything to survive. Indeed these collaborators are a cabal of miscreants that could FUBAR anyone's attempt to survive and to me, that what's really scary. Well done!
Really enjoyed the storyline; new approach to zombie genre that works. On the downside, could do without the romance/love scenes, but that's just me. Will probably buy the next installment.

Mr. Sisavath does an excellent job of grabbing you and not letting go until the very end. As many other reviewers have noted this is not your typical zombie apocalypse story. There is plenty of character development that is not always present in PA work. The ghouls remind me of the creatures from the film "I am Legend," fast, creepy and plentiful.

It was a total page turner, once i started reading i couldn't stop. I purchased and read the Kindle Copy but enjoyed it so much i bought the paperbacks so i could loan them to friends and family. I've finished the third book and am impatiently waiting for the fourth installment.

Taking zombie apocalypse to a different path. The storylince stays on track with lots of adventure, shooting goullike zombies, sort of, bad guys, good guys, a little romance, and ups and downs. Very enjoyable and realistic.

I couldn't stop reading this book.  I downloaded the kindle sample and was hooked almost immediately.  Great story telling, it flows smooth as butter.  Fun and interesting characters, lots of action from start to finish.  Will and Danny's banter back and forth actually made me laugh out loud a couple times.  If you're thinking about getting this book, stop thinking, and just do it.

Great book couldn't put it down and now I'm on book two! I loved that this book had a different type of creature than zombies, vampire or aliens.  The monsters in this book are like all three smashed in to one terrible creature.  Only one question ..how to the Ghouls keep a  body farm where they feed on humans, but the humans don't turn?That was the only part I didn't get, but I'm hoping all will be revealed in the next two books.  Anyway,  the characters are well written and the story goes a a fast clip filled with action!  Definitely recommend you read it!

I was looking for a good zombie book and stumbled across this gem! First thing I noticed about the book was the interesting title, and it caught my attention. So I downloaded the sample and made it halfway before I said I am HOOKED!!!! I immediately bought it and it was definitely worth it. Even though it's not about zombies it is definitely a creature feature, and the characters are great! Do glad I found this diamond in the rough!

I can't believe I haven't come across this author before as he's an great storyteller.  The character development is some of the best I've ever read.  Will and Danny's back-and-forthing made me grin quite a lot.  And the people they encounter in their travels are very real people doing the very real things they would do in an apocalypse, both good and evil.  As soon as I finished the first book, I bought the second and third and didn't stop until I finished them.  This is not just your ordinary zombie (ghoul) series.  Blue eyed ghoul leaders have a plan for the humans and it's not good.  I can't wait until the next book!  Highly recommended!
Well written with good character dialogue. Realistic as far as this type book can be. Sequel is just as good.
Couldn't put it down! This was my first zombie type novel. Already started the second one and it's looking just as good.
solid, entertaining read. kept me on the edge of my seat. highly recommended for dark thriller type novels. definitely worth the cost.
Great read. Kept my attention til the end. Can't wait for next book. One of the best books I have ever read

The author does a great job connecting you to each and every character, I have my favorites and my foe's. Add some Ghoul's (zombies) into the mix and it's a nail biting war zone. I'm now into the 2nd book and can't wait to finish so I can read the 3rd. I only wish the author could write faster than I could read. I want to follow these people in the new world.  Great work Sam Sisavath.
The subject... destruction of our world , as we know it, in a very different way!  You will want more!

I think the book has a very interesting main theme and some rather well developed characters. It has plenty of drama and some humor along with a little clumsy romance. I am currently reading the seconds book in this series of three. There are several typos and missed edits in the book but they are minor. Totally enjoyed this book! What more do I need to say. Will be buying the next one for sure .
Thoroughly enjoyed the read.  It is late into the night and I just finished it. Always a good sign when u can't put it down.

Very fast paced and different twist on other post apocalyptic novels. I felt it was more optimistic than other novels like it. But still terrifying. Packed with excitement and funny banter at the most inappropriate moments (on purpose), it was very enjoyable!
I love a good world end novel and this one has true character development and a plot that flows fluidly.
The story was kept me enthralled and I could hardly put the book down! I read books in this genre and this is one of the best series. I love the characters

This is a very good book, loved the characters and the plot is new and imaginative.  Can't wait to start the next one.  I haven't decided if I'll wait for it to be free or buy it.  I read faster than one book a month I'm afraid.  I highly recommend this to lovers of zombie type books.
Great storytelling, great characters and an exciting read.  Already bought books 2 and 3 in the series.  Hard to believe this is a debut novel. I'm definitely of fan of Sam Sisavath.
As with the rest of this series, this was a welcome edition.  Good characters, plot and story.  A fun read.  Recommend.

This is a solid book with a unique take on the post apocalyptic genre.  Very good storyline with some very intense portions.  Great at character building too!  Some of the banter between the two main characters was a bit juvenile, but in the end it worked somehow. Solid writing, which noticeably improved into book 2... which was even better.  If you like this book at all, you'll definitely like The Gates of Byzantium.

Unbelievablely well written. You want to pace yourself but can not literally read within 24 hr. period. Loved all the characters wanted Will with Kate at first but can not wait to see where this goes. Wow outstanding. Love. Love love.  :)

So many of these books are so poorly edited and, frankly, poorly written - not the case with this one.  I certainly liked it well enough to buy #2 and that one is just as entertaining. Wow what a good read.  It caught me and pulled me in fast!  The plot was excellent and the characters well put together.  SF and the end of the world well meshed together.

Holy crap the monsters in this thing are scary as hell. Awesome! Great read didn't want to put it down, very intense and funny with Will and Danny. All of the characters are great
WOW!  Incredible read!  This is a page turner.  I need to get my hands on the second book in the series as soon as I finish this review.

This story will keep you on the edge of your seat from the beginning!  Think "Walking Dead" on crack! It is a really good read that will leave you breathless and searching for relief!  It is a edgy, new take on the walking dead.

Firstly I love post apocalyptic books and really loved this one. Based on reading all the great reviews before me I bought this one. Ok if you are in to grammar etc maybe this is not the one for you. However if you just want action, fiction and a great story this is the one for you. I gave it 5 stars because I literally could not put the book down and am on to the 2nd one and loving it. I also really liked the relationship between the 2 main characters.
This dude knows how to write a book like a boss ! Well done, well done indeed. Just started #2 in the collection !
This is one of the most exciting "end-of-the-world" books and made me want to read the other two!  Highly recommend

Sisavath goes back to the roots in this end of the world story and does a pretty good job of rethinking how things play out.  His characters are a bit cliché and 'over-the-top' but the story moves well with some interesting (if telegraphed) twists.  There were moments it felt like Sisavath was worried more about film rights then plot line, but it was good enough to look forward towards book two.

Pretty good reading.  The characters were well developed and there were a few turns that I did not see coming.  I'm already reading book #2 "The Gates of Byzantium," and put it down long enough to write this review.
I just love a book that scares you so bad that you have to close it and walk around to calm yourself.  Can't wait to read the next in the series. Ordering it right now.

The main characters, Will and Danny, are kind of like a "Starsky and Hutch" and always have a good back and forth banter.  Just good all around!

I'm not one for writing reviews but I really enjoyed this book and have bought the second and will but the third (and fourth, when it comes out). I'm cheap so that's glowing on my terms.

Even after being a zombie flick fan for decades, I've only read 4-5 zombie novels in my entire life. This is my very first review for one, so, CONGRATULATIONS, Sam Sisavath, for your entertainment!  From character development to explaining YOUR idea of how the End of The World might happen, this first novel I've read of yours leaves me feeling like I've just lived through I Am LEGEND- 2007 ( I am legend is an adaptation of a sci-fi novel of the same name by Richard Matheson; a novel which also inspired the making of both George Romero’s Night of the living dead and the 1970s movie Omega Man.  Robert Neville [Will Smith] is the last living man in New York and as far as he’s aware the last living man on the planet. Immune to a killer virus that wiped out most of humanity and turned the rest into flesh eating zombies, the only reason he has for staying alive is to a find a cure. At night the virus victims who have become enraged night walkers stalk the streets, giving Neville only daylight to gather supplies and continue his work. Aware that his location will eventually be found Neville works against the clock to find the cure before it’s too late.), The Terror Within-1989 (where the world has been changed by an accident involving Biological warfare as a result of this it horribly mutates humans into monsters called gargoyles.) Or one of my absolute TOP THREE ZOMBIE FLICKS, Night of The Comet-1984 ("They Came. They Shopped. They Saved The World!"  Cult sci-fi comedy from the 1980’s had very little promotion on its release and would have slipped away into obscurity if it wasn’t for a small but dedicated group of fans.  After a comet passes close by the Earth two sisters wake up to find that the majority of the worlds population have been disintegrated, leaving only a handful of mutated zombies roaming the streets. Seemingly the only survivors in an all but empty world, they set out trying to make sense of what’s happened and soon stumble across another survivor. Together they take advantage of the vacant world that’s become their playground unaware that scientists in an underground facility are monitoring their every move.). I have decided that I MUST read the rest of this series in order to discover what happens to the survivors of this first wave of The Purge.  Worth every penny you spend for a nice, lazy day kindle read!

First, let me say this is a great story and it is extremely well written. I have read all three books in the series and look forward to the next one. The ONLY reason this does not get 5 stars is because of the unrealistic way the good guys recover from bullet wounds. Every wound is a through-and-through wound and everyone recovers from these wounds within 24 hours - or at least recovers enough that they are back fighting and involved in strenuous activities in that period of time. Bullet wounds are traumatic and devastating to the body. I would prefer the good guys not get shot at all than to have them get shot and then act like it never happened. Again, that is my only criticism. The writing is great. The characters are engaging. The plot is well paced. This is great entertainment! I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a great End of the World or zombie series. You won't be disappointed.

Wow! Kudos to Sam Sisavath for creating such a powerful, action packed read. This wasn't a short 250 page book by any means. It was like 3 books in one and the action never let up. You follow several groups of people across Texas as they battle their way through the undead and what they lovingly call the 'ghouls'. These creatures are not our normal everyday zombies. They are deathly allergic to sunlight, bullets do not kill them and they are smart. Way too smart. Will and Danny, two of the characters you will meet, are SWAT team members and ex-Rangers. They will have you chuckling throughout the entire book. They keep things lighthearted and have a great relationship. Always finding humor, even when the situation seems dire. As they meet up with other survivors and start to make their way to a safe house, you see the survivors begin to depend not only on them but on this continued lightheartedness. That if they can remain calm and joke around when thousands of these creatures are swarming them, then the situation must not be that bad. In this book, we see things get shot, blown up (which is always a favorite of mine), heads cut off and quick one-liners that bring a smile to your face. Yes, there is some romance thrown in, but in my opinion it didn't take too much away from the action and it helped to tie some things together in the end. I highly recommend this book. Be prepared to spend way too many nights up too late reading!!
